message: Totally selfish request: Not the weekend of May 7th since I've already got plans... ;)

There is a pretty prominent hacker space in SF, maybe that could be used as a venue or even a place to maybe get word out?

We'll jaw here about trying to organize a miniconference sometime in May in the SF bay area.    Things we know: 20-80 folks, informal unconference style.  Things we need:  a venue and volunteers for organizing.
http://groups.google.com/group/pylons-project-mini-conference
should we maybe call it like june instead or maybe even later.. 2 months is gonna go by pretty fast
we are bootstrapping a Palo Alto pyweb group, so we can use that to get the word out too
so... maybe we fly mcdonc out to see Rammstein on 5/81 (if he's interested), talk at AltoPy on thursday, mini-mini-con on friday, sprint on saturday and/or sunday?
how is May 14
or we could try for the weekend of Rammstein
but giving it more time gives us more chances to commit sins of enthusiasm
I think a smaller 2-4 talk meet-up within the next 2 months would be good. With a larger mini-conf 2-3 months after that.
The HappyDevHouse things are usually at capacity already, not sure they'd have space to add 20+ Pylons/Python devs.
I can commit to things within the next 6 weeks or so, or mid-July and later with reasonable certainty I'll be around. (thus my suggestion earlier)
@chrismcdonough, @benbangert would 5/18 - 5/21 work for you?
and others?
@whitmo May is questionable for me, I won't know more about dates I'll be free for another 2-3 weeks.
Speaking selfishly - 2 months is too short to organise anything transatlantic. September would be my preference for any sustained get together.
charlie, there will be more opportunities
Undoubtedly, and from the posts so far you're looking for some smaller, initially. Which makes sense.
@benbangert are you possibly headed back to siberia?
hey so would one of you mind adding me to the pylons project so I can start a project for the mini conf?
@whitmo those dates work for me
@whitmo: https://github.com/Pylons/miniconference/admin

+ 1 with Ben's suggestion: "I think a smaller 2-4 talk meet-up within the next 2 months would be good. With a larger mini-conf 2-3 months after that."  I can see about moving May's talk and do another SF python meet-up.
so we are thinking end of april now?

I'm a little confused about what we're even talking about any more.  Originally I thought the idea was to have a Pylons Project sprint, which I think is a great idea; that's what I'd like more than anything.  Then Ben suggested that, since there's a lot of demand and we'd have a lot of Pylons Project folks in the same place, maybe we could take a half-day to do a meet-up of sorts, inviting folks from the larger community, esp. folks that have been using Pylons but aren't really up to speed on Pyramid, to come learn some stuff and get a chance to ask questions.

All that sounds like a great idea... and, while I'm intrigued by the possibility of a "mini-conference" later in the year, with more talks and tracks and logistics, I'd be bummed if the original idea of a sprint (plus a few talks, possibly) got lost in the shuffle.
yeah... I'm holding the torch for the original idea and doing it in the next couple months
let's call it a micro-conference: 2-5 talks, and some unstructured presentation time w/ beer
then a sprint on the next day
if that goes well, something bigger can build atop it
we commit to that, if others want to add stuff atop it that doesn't mess up the original idea, bueno!
Sounds great to me.  I'd even be down for more than a single day of sprinting, although my availability to do so depends quite a bit on some work-related unknowns.
cool.
Hacker Dojo can host in mountain view
I say we have it in June.
FYI: roughly same time frame for those who might want to do a West Coast tour.  It's good stuff. http://opensourcebridge.org/  Still taking proposals for talks too.
i'm game for either may or june, whatever works for whit really... let's not let the idea die though through scheduling-and-topic-oriented stop energy

As this is a stalking horse for larger events, folks should feel assured that there will be more events they can participate in not too long after whatever we do now.   iow, you might want to save your travel time and money for the big event, not the trial run.
The heuristic for decision is going to be what date works best for Chris and Ben next 2 months.
I'll love to see this happening but I can't justify the ticket too soon. I'll defnitely go to a future one, maybe close to/near pycon2012
After chatting with ben and chris a bit more, looks like the best feasible date for the conf and sprints is the weekend of April 29, 30, 31
alright, I'll send something to dev and discuss later today
or whatever the lists are called
locked in
Are you aware of BayPIGgies?  Their next meeting is Thu, Apr 28, held at the Symantec campus in Mountain View, CA, a stone's throw away from Palo Alto. http://baypiggies.net/

For the record, we've decided that the days will be the 28th through the 30th, with the evening of the 28th reserved for talks and the remainder reserved for sprinting I think.  @steve_piercy, I dont think we were... I've forwarded that info to the folks "on the ground" there, maybe there's an opportunity for consolidation.
(those are april dates, ftr)
Whoops, I may have mixed up those dates.. the *29th* is for talks, not the 28th... see also http://groups.google.com/group/pylons-devel/browse_thread/thread/c40a4d51b948aeb5 ..
Any objection to combining the sprint with an Allura sprint (http://sf.net/p/allura)? We'll be porting it to Pyramid and providing a tg-like shim at the time....

Sprints @ Nextspace in about an hour.
Leaving Santa Cruz to head up to Pylons Sprints @ Nextspace. See you in 2 hours.
@ericflo take a look at venusian, its a single separate package used by Pyramid for the scan and decorator 'registering' behavior Chris was showing. It's *very* useful when making frameworky stuff.

@ericflo the docs for it (I have a Celery task decorator that uses venusian as well I need to package up as its handy to delay the 'task' decoration) http://docs.pylonsproject.org/projects/venusian/dev/
